gurmukhi: clMq qICxo AsM iKmMq Dwr au`jlM ]ppwq AMgd kysrI hnU v sugiÍM blM ]790]
transliteration: Chalan Teechhano Asan Khimant Dhaar Ujjalan|| Papaat Anad Kesarihanoo Va Sougrivan Balan||790||
translation: The sharp sword of white edges were struck in the battlefield, the strength of Angad, Hanuman, Sugriva etc. began to wean away.790.

gurmukhi: igrMq AwsurM rxM BBrm AwsurI issM ]qjMq isAwmxo DrM BjMq pRwn lY BtM ]
transliteration: Girant Aasuran Ranan Bhabharm Aasurisisan|| Tajant Siaamannd Dharan Bhajant Praan Lai Bhatan||
translation: The demons began to fall in the battlefield and they got this illusion that these boys were the magical demon boys, they began to leave the earth and flee away saving their lives;

gurmukhi: auTMq AMD DuMDxo kbMD bMDqM ktM ]lgMq bwxxo brM igrMq Bum AhvXM ]791]
transliteration: Outhant Andh Dhoundhano Kabandh Bandhatan Katan|| Lagadt Baan-no Baran Girant Bhoom Abavyan||791||
translation: Headless trunks, chopping their shackles began to rise violently and being shot by the arrows began to fall again in the battlefield.791.

gurmukhi: ppwq qiRCxM DrM bbyg mwr qu`jxM ]BrMq DUr BUrxM bmMq sRoxqM muKM ]
transliteration: Papaat Trouchhnan Dharan Babeg Maar Tujjanan|| Bharant Dhoor Bhoornan Hamannd Srontan Moukhan||
translation: The warriors being shot by arrows quickly began to fall on the earth, the dust clung to their bodies and the blood oozed out from their mouths;

gurmukhi: ickwr cwNvfI nBM iPkMq iPMkrI iPrM ]Bkwr BUq pRyqxM ifkwr fwkxI fulM ]792]
transliteration: Chikaar Chaanvadinabhan Phikant Phidkariphiran|| Bhakaar Bhoot Pretanan Dikaar Dulan||792||
translation: The vultures shrieked and roamed circularly in the sky , the ghosts and fiends began to shout in the battlefield and the vampires roamed while belching. 792.

gurmukhi: igrY DrM DurM DrM Drw DrM DrM ijvM ]BB`ij sRauxqM qxy auTMq BY krI DunM ]
transliteration: Girai Dharan Dhuran Dharan Dharaa Dharan Dharan Jivan|| Bhabhajj(i) Sraounatan Tane Outhant Bhai Karidhounan||
translation: The warriors, on whatever side of the earth they were, began to fal, the blood flowed from the bodies of the fleeing warriors and there were terrible shouts;

gurmukhi: auTMq g`d s`dxM nn`d iniPrM rxM ]bbrK swiekM isqM GumMq joDxo bRxM ]793]
transliteration: Outhant Gadd Saddanan Nanadd Niphiran Ranan|| Babarakh Saaekan Sitan Ghoumant Ghoumant Jodhano Branan||793||
translation: The resonance of fifes filled the battlefield and the clusters of warriors showering the arrows and being inflicted with wounds began to wander.793.

gurmukhi: BjMq BY DrM BtM iblok BrQxo rxM ]clXo icrwiekY cpI bbrK swieko isqM ]
transliteration: Bhajat Bhai Dharan Bhaeean Bilok Bharthano Ranan|| Chadyo Chiraaekai Chapibabarkh Saaeko Sitan||
translation: Seeing the war of Bharat, many warriors began to run away fearfully. On this side, in great fury, Bharat began to shower arrows.

gurmukhi: su kRu`D swiekM issM bb`D Bwlxo BtM ]ppwq piRQvIXM hTI mmoh AwsR mMgqM ]794]
transliteration: Su Kruddh Saaekan Sisan Babaddh Dhaalano Bhatan|| Papaat Prithveeyan Hathimamoh Aasra Mantan||794||
translation: The sons of the sage in great ire showered a volley of arrows and caused Bharat to fall on the earth.794.

gurmukhi: BB`ij BIqxo BtM qq`ij BrQxo BUAM ]igrMq lu`QqM auTM rurod rwGvM qtM ]
transliteration: Bhabhajj(i) Bheetano Bhatan Tatajj(i) Bharthano Bhooan|| Girant Loutthatan Outhan Rurod Raaghavan Tatan||
translation: The warriors fled leaving Bharat fallen on the earth and rising and falling over corpses they came to Ram.

gurmukhi: juJy su BRwq BrQxo suxMq jwnkI pqM ]ppwq BUimxo qlM ApIV pIVqM duKM ]795]
transliteration: Jujhe Su Bhraat Bharthano Sounant Jaanakipatan|| Papaat Bhoomino Talan Apeed Peedatan Doukhan||795||
translation: When Ram came to Know of the death of Bharat, then highly anguished with sorrows he fell down of the earth.795.

gurmukhi: ss`j joDxM juDI su kRu`D b`Dxo brM ]qq`ij j`g mMflM AdMf dMfxo nrM ]
transliteration: Sasajj Jodhanan Judhisu Kruddh Baddhano Baran|| Tatajj(i) Jagg Mandalan Adand Danndano Naran||
translation: Ram himself started for war in great fury after decorating his army of warriors in order to kill the brave fighters and punish the unpunished;

gurmukhi: su g`j b`j bwjxo auTMq BY DrI surM ]sn`D b`D KY dlM sb`D joDxo brM ]796]
transliteration: Su Gadj Bajj Haajano Outhant Bhai Dhari Suran|| Sanaddh Baddh Khai Dalan Sabaddh Jodhano Baran||796||
translation: Hearing the voices of the elephants and the horses, the gods also became fearful and in this army there were several heroes who could destroy the bedecked forces.796.

gurmukhi: cc`k cwNvfI nBM iPkMq iPMkrI DrM ]BKMq mws hwrxM bmMq jÍwl durgXM ]
transliteration: Chachakk Chaanvadinabhan Phikant Phinkaridharan|| Bhakhannddmaas Haarnan Bamannd Jvaal Durgadan||
translation: Roaming in he sky, the vultures began to move on the earth, the goddess Durga, appeared showering innumerable fires and eating the flesh.
